reviewText: this movie became blockbuster movie, and I was thinking why. It is strictly one time watch and I guess everybody went to theater and watched it once. I still did not get what this movie was all about.May buy for Ranbir's acting in some sequence and chemistry between him and deepika, else this movie is not that good either.
Title: Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani Hindi Movie / Bollywood Film / Indian Cinema

reviewText: IMHO, many years down the road when people look back at the career of Ranbir Kapoor they will realise that this was the movie with which he finally embraced superstardom. Movies in the past did matter, but they were made to showcase the actor in him, but post YJHD, RK's movies will be known for the commercial pursuits than pure acting showcases. I mean, he may occasionally flirt with a creative pursuit however the singular goal will be about keeping the throne, which I think he has landed with YJHD( However I wish I am proven wrong).The film is about about three friends, Bunny played by Ranbir Kapoor ( Why would one want to name their child after a rabbit?) wants to travel the world and flirt with every moving thing, Aditi ( Kalki Koechlin), a boy in a womans body who just wants to live and Avi ( Aditya Roy Kapoor) alcohol riddled and consumed with money losing ideas. These three take a road trip to Manali and meet Naina, a bumbling, introverted, bookish medical student who has never had fun according to the standards of these friends. This journey changes their lives forever, culminating in a meeting at a wedding that takes place, eight years after that road trip in Udaipur. The plot sounds similar to DDLJ, and it is in many ways, this is just a old rehash in a brand new box- the father and son relationship between Farooque Sheikh and Ranbir is touching and tender. The director Ayan Mukherjee has a flair for such scenes, does anyone remember the parental scenes in Wake up Sid? - not a dry eye in the house. YJHD is a mashup of every bollywood romance that was successful and is a satisfying journey of emotions- high and low, high fashion and gloss and very rich people falling in love- who the hell gets to marry in a palace in Udaipur? The movie begins with rambunctiousness but turns mellow in a good way towards the end- reflecting the coming of age of the four characters. High fashion, beautiful locations and good songs border the film including a item song by Madhuri Dixit whose name is Mohini (cheesy and cheap this one)RK is perfect as flirt who does not want to settle down- so the entire film is about him learning about life through love and loss. Siddharth Roy is amazing- why does this guy not get more acting jobs- Hopefully Aashiqui 2 will change the status quo.Deepika and Kalki are in one word just WOW- they literally steal the show in many many places. Kalki edges out Deepika eventually with her chops and thats because her role has that kind of arc.YJHD is a name borrowed from a oldie and reflects the aspirations of the Indian youth to a certain extent with the usual roadblocks that all of us experience- dejection, rejection, first love, heartbreak, loss etc.Karan Johar the producer infuses the film with the gloss and the leads give it the chemistry. This is a romantic film but there are enough explorations to make you think in places but that feeling is momentary as the thought is broken by another scene. At 2 hours and 40 minutes- this a long ride but an engaging one.......Definitely for the crazy in love and also for the jaded old ones....five stars 5/10/2013
summary: A film for the ones in love and for the jaded ones too.....
Title: Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani Hindi Movie / Bollywood Film / Indian Cinema

reviewText: My family have loved Bollywood musicals since 2003 when my wife and I saw Bombay Dreams in London.  They're often a throwback to a kind of entertainment Hollywood abandoned years ago.  Television has brought them back in the form of Glee and a dozen talent shows, but for a story driven musical film experience, Bollywood is where the action is.Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani is a great example.  Don't expect plot twists, just enjoy the ride and the dancing.  This is a sweet story about good-yet-imperfect people living their lives.The film is in Hindi, but that doesn't make it harder to enjoy.  In fact, the subtitles add some unintended comedy when the dialog switches to English and the subtitles don't match what's actually being said.  Like all the best Bollywood films, Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani will make you wish you could dance.UPDATE - the packaging of the DVD is worth an additional comment.  In this pricerange you sometimes get a cardboard case with plastic clasp.  Ye Jawaani Hai Deewani has a sleeve and a trifold interior case.  There are two DVDs, the film and the extra materials.  The only downside is that shipping is apparently unpredictable.  It took some time, and arrived before Amazon had it listed on my account as shipped (though I had gotten an email).  The film does have subtitles, but not for the songs.  Odd and disappointing, but hardly a deal breaker.
Title: Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani Hindi Movie / Bollywood Film / Indian Cinema

reviewText: My old pal Bollywood Bob and I were chillin' the other day, he munching on a plate of paranthas, me having a Coke and a smile. At some point Bollywood Bob confessed to me that the secret to sustained success rests not on innovation, which is hard to come by, but rather on taking what's old hat and executing the thing with flair and enthusiasm and with competence. And should this be applied to cinema, it helps that the two leads caught up in that familiar old dance generate chemistry. YEH JAWAANI HAI DEEWANI, in giving the people what they want, made a crapload of money at the Indian box office. It perhaps cemented Ranbir Kapoor as Bollywood's fastest rising new superstar and reaffirms that Deepika Padukone is one of today's most engaging, most captivating performers.My old pal Bollywood Bob snickered when detailing the less-than-fresh plot trajectory. Kabir "Bunny" Thapar (Ranbir Kapoor) and his two best pals, impulsive Aditi (Kalki Koechlin) and easy-going Avi (Aditya Roy Kapur), are off to a climbing expedition in mountainous Manali. They're joined on a whim by the studious Naina Talwar (Deepika Padukone), a casual acquaintance and former classmate who suspects she's been missing out on life and is curious to see what the fuss is all about. The film's first half chronicles their madcap misadventures in Manali. We note the personality traits, the attractions established, the tight-knit group dynamics that shift just so to make room for Naina.Bespectacled bookworm Naina. Except that when you resemble Deepika Padukone, the opposite sex can't fail to notice. At some point, Bunny, incorrigible ladies' man, drops an observation to Naina: "Girls like you aren't made for flirting... you're made for love. And love... is very bad for my health."If someone were to tell you that the narrative revolves around Bunny's trying to find himself, that someone goofed. Yes, this is a coming-of-age story. But Bunny is well aware of who he is, and what he wants, and how to go about achieving what he wants. What informs the core of the story conflict is Bunny's struggle to prioritize the things that matter to him most. Bunny is a restless soul, his restlessness compelling him to travel the globe, to explore its distant nooks and crannies. It's this wanderlust that severs his ties with his friends, that cuts off whatever it was that had been building between him and Naina. The film's intermission finds Bunny living his dream, a professional vagabond with a camera. It finds Naina moving on.You live, you love, you suffer heartbreak, you get over it eventually, rinse, repeat... It's not ever cool when my old pal Bollywood Bob starts waxing philosophical on romance; he starts quoting instructions from the dishwashing machine. Post-interval, eight years had elapsed. We ought to catch up. Bunny's career has taken off. Easy-going Avi's has not, and he's not so easy-going anymore, not after a string of failed business enterprises. After years apart, the four friends reunite to attend Aditi's wedding in resplendent Udaipur. In the days leading up to the nuptials, brace yourself for when festering grudges and jealousies are exposed and teary-eyed declarations are blurted out. Oboy, nothing like a lavish Indian wedding to inspire crazy melodrama... and crazy dancing.Look, just shrug off the heap of clichés. You won't even care about them, this film is that good. YEH JAWAANI HAI DEEWANI preserves a delicate balance. It presents a hip, contemporary perspective while championing traditional values. Bunny is a womanizer and will chase any good-looking tail. Naina fiercely demands her own space independent of her parents' expectations. And yet, push comes to shove, Bunny and Naina exhibit deep affection for their parents. They respectfully take in the wisdom imparted by those elders.It'd be messed up if I didn't mention how much I enjoyed Kalki Koechlin's performance. Of all the character arcs in this film, hers is the most interesting and unexpected trajectory. She may not be as strikingly photogenic as Deepika, but there's just something about her. Kalki seems to be in the moment in every scene she's in. Meanwhile, Evelyn Sharma's sexy but clueless party girl nabs several choice comic moments. And, as the cherry on top, there's a Madhuri Dixit sighting in the shape of an item number. Yep, she's still got it. There's my old pal Bollywood Bob, drooling.YEH JAWAANI HAI DEEWANI offers nothing new. You see every twist and complication coming, with the possible exception of Aditi's arc. Watching this, you may smile and weep, and, if you're at that certain age, you may reminisce about when you, too, were young and stood at a crossroad and made mistakes and fell in and out of love and lived life like tomorrows were non-existent. Me, too, man, I did all that.This DVD set comes with two discs. Disc 1 has the feature film with optional English or Arabic sub-titles and the option to skip right to the musical numbers. Disc 2 has the following bonus features (note that most of these featurettes have enough spoken English in them that non-Hindi speakers like me can keep up):- Making of the Film featurette (00:22:27 minutes long)- Making of the musical number "Badtameez Dil" (00:05:58 minutes)- Making of the musical number "Balam Pichkari" (00:05:56 minutes)- 10 Deleted Scenes (totaling 00:17:55 minutes, no English sub-titles)- Theatrical Trailer
summary: "How long can we go on like this? We're growing up."
Title: Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani Hindi Movie / Bollywood Film / Indian Cinema

Title: Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani Hindi Movie / Bollywood Film / Indian Cinema

reviewText: If you have not seen this movie, what are you waiting for??? I'm a little prejudice bc i think ayan mukerji is basically a genius but the majority of people must agree bc both of his films have been hits!!This movie starts out with a wedding invitation and naina (deepika) reminiscing to 8 years back when she was nerdy,akward,self-conscious and clearly unhappy with the way her life was. She decides on a whim to go on a trip after bumping into an old school mate... and that's when she bumps into bunny (ranbir) and her life begins to change... He helps her to see that she is special and unique in her own way.. if she stops feeling sorry for herself and starts loving herself everything will be fine... due to a career choice on bunny's part after the trip they all go their seperate ways.8 years later they are all re-united by this weddingomg just explaining it makes me want to run home and watch it! It is among my top two favorites of 2013!!
Title: Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani Hindi Movie / Bollywood Film / Indian Cinema

reviewText: Last june I was loking for music videos of Bollywood and I found Balam Pichikari. I was curious about the movie and all the glamour suround it. I fall in love with this movie! It's a Hindi blockbuster because have all the thing we want to see in a movie. Romance, great performance, good music and beautiful locations. I recomended this movie and also bought Barfi! (Ranbir Kapor) great movie too.If you're tired of Hollywood and want to see something different.... Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani! After that I believe I can dance like Deepika .....
summary: Excelent for take a break from Hollywood
Title: Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani Hindi Movie / Bollywood Film / Indian Cinema

reviewText: Yeh Jawani Hai Deewani directed by Ayan Mukerji was one of the biggest hits of 2013 and it was absolutely charming. Initially I opted to watch the movie only to see Madhuri Dixit perform in the song ‘Gaghra’. I’d assumed the movie to be a frilly n frothy meaningless run-of-the mill Hindi movie. This movie is definitely frothy, but Ranbir Kapoor and Deepika Padukone’s honest portrayal of the lead couple warms the heart and made me believe in their love story.
Title: Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani Hindi Movie / Bollywood Film / Indian Cinema

reviewText: Fun, new movie for me with refreshing actors, fun songs and dancing and lots of love.  Seeing Deepika in my first movie with her was worth it!
Title: Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani Hindi Movie / Bollywood Film / Indian Cinema
